definition: abreast of modern developments/to keep up with the times/progressive/timely
to take part in
and/to give/together with
variant of 歟|欤[yu2]
surname Shi
old variant of 時|时[shi2]
o'clock/time/when/hour/season/period
entirely/without exception/(literary) to be together/to be alike
to go forward/to advance/to go in/to enter/to put in/to submit/to take in/to admit/(math.) base of a number system/classifier for sections in a building or residential compound

sentences.english: Keeping up with the times is the most prominent hallmark of the new period.
sentences.chinese: 新时期最突出的标志是与时俱进。

sentences.english: Every year, the show will release the new season and the stories keep pace with the time.
sentences.chinese: 每年，该节目会播出新季，故事也会与时俱进。

sentences.english: The Western broadcasters contend they have simply moved with the times.
sentences.chinese: 但西方广播界争辨说他们只是“与时俱进”而已。

sentences.english: The company advocates the philosophy of "people-oriented, moving forward with times, innovation and development".
sentences.chinese: 公司崇尚“以人为本”，与时俱进，开拓创新。

sentences.english: Construction Project Budgeting and Final Accounting Specialty should undergo reforms.
sentences.chinese: 基建工程预决算专业的教学改革应与时俱进。

sentences.english: The views of the Three Generation Leading Group share the same root and keep pace with times.
sentences.chinese: 三代中央领导集体的发展观既一脉相承，又与时俱进。

sentences.english: Dinggu Enterprise is ready to keep pace with the times, and create a wonderful future together with people of aall circles.
sentences.chinese: 顶固企业愿与社会各界人士与时俱进，共创美好将来。

sentences.english: They just couldn't keep it up, Anne.
sentences.chinese: 她们不能让它保持与时俱进，安妮。

sentences.english: The people who advance with times is advisability.
sentences.chinese: 与时俱进的人才是明智的人。

sentences.english: It really was just,  even as a physical object, all bound up with the politics of its moment.
sentences.chinese: 这样看来，她的想法在当时的确与时俱进。

sentences.english: In demand of being a party affairs worker, we need to update our idea and keep up with the times.
sentences.chinese: 更新观念，与时俱进，是时代赋予党务工作者的要求。

sentences.english: This kind of system requires keeping up with the times.
sentences.chinese: 这种体系需要保持与时俱进。

sentences.english: Attention should be given to hearing courses, with the hearing without textbooks is infeasible.
sentences.chinese: 要重视听力课程，没有与时俱进的听力课本是不行的。

sentences.english: Faced with the new situation, Party building among university students must keep pace with the times.
sentences.chinese: 面对新形势，高校学生党建工作必须与时俱进。

sentences.english: It is required to keep pace with the time and improve fire fighting.
sentences.chinese: 与时俱进做好消防工作是新时期的新要求。

sentences.english: Professor Wang Ning believes that the standard of Chinese characters should be updated with time.
sentences.chinese: 王宁教授相信，中国汉字标准应该与时俱进。

definition: to push out the old and bring in the new (idiom); to innovate
daily renewal, monthly change (idiom)/every day sees new developments/rapid progress
to discard the old and introduce the new (idiom); to innovate
innovation/to bring forth new ideas/to blaze new trails
creativity
stuck in the old ways (idiom); refusing to acknowledge new ideas/stagnating and conservative
(idiom) to continue in the same old rut/diehard conservative attitudes
hidebound by convention (idiom)
tide/current/trend
new age
to cherish the outmoded and preserve the outworn (idiom); conservative/stickler for tradition
to take the best/to absorb the essence
to dare to be first/to pioneer (idiom)
to transform/to change
to develop/to make full use of
age/era/epoch/period (in one's life)/CL:個|个[ge4]
Time, US weekly news magazine
